question: Y in the reaction sequence is:
<katex>$\text{Phenol} \xrightarrow{NaOH} A \xrightarrow[(ii) H^+]{(i) CO_2} B \xrightarrow[(ii) H^+]{(i) (CH_3CO)_2O} Y \text{ (Major product)}$</katex>
explanation: 1. Phenol + NaOH + CO2 (Kolbe's reaction) forms Salicylic acid (B).
2. Acetylation of Salicylic acid with acetic anhydride produces Acetylsalicylic acid, which is Aspirin (Y).
